Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER FIDLER.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Council Member Fidler moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 26, 2003, be adopted and printed by Council Member Stewart.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Stewart moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of  February 26, 2003 be adopted as printed.

By Council Members Dilan, Boyland and Barron:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20010721 PPK shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title:
By Council Member Monserrate:

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Extension of Remarks
Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation to issue a heightened stormwater permit program for the East-of-Hudson area of the New York City Watershed.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: NYS Dept of Environmental Conservation to issue a heightened stormwater permit program for the East-of-Hudson area of the NYC Watershed.

Items.Title: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an adopt-a-park program.
Items.MatterName: Creating an adopt-a-park program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to improving the mechanism for filing complaints and conducting inspections for housing violations.
Items.MatterName: Improving the mechanism for filing complaints and conducting inspections for housing violations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Augusta National Golf Club to cease its practice of gender segregation and urging all television networks and other media, particularly CBS Broadcasting, to refrain from broadcasting the Masters in 2004 and future years as long as it is held at Augusta or any other venue that promotes segregation and discrimination.
Items.MatterName: Condemning the gender segregation practiced by the Augusta National Golf Club.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to requiring an annual report to the mayor, the council, the borough boards and community planning boards on all jobs retained and created as a result of the sale of city-owned property through an agreement with entities which enter into contracts with the department of small business services.
Items.MatterName: Reports, entities which enter into contracts with the Dept of small business services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the setting of water and sewer charges.
Items.MatterName: Setting of water and sewer charges.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the planting of drought-resistant trees and vegetation on city-owned property.
Items.MatterName: Planting of drought-resistant trees and vegetation on city-owned property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to low-flow sink and lavatory faucets.
Items.MatterName: Low-flow sink and lavatory faucets.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Environmental Protection Agency to create a program for water-efficient products similar to the ENERGY STAR(r) program for energy-efficient products.
Items.MatterName: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency to create a program for water-efficient products similar to the ENERGY STAR(r) program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation to amend the Real Property Tax Law in relation to expanding the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) to senior citizen heads of household occupying units in non-rent regulated buildings, and in buildings not subject to the Private Housing Finance Law.
Items.MatterName: Expanding the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to reopen, and duly publicize, the Federal Emergency Management Agency's Mortgage and Rental Assistance program, which expired by law on May 30, 2002 and whose special 9/11 implementation was terminated on January 31, 2003, and to extend the program's deadline for filing for benefits for an additional six months, as it relates to New York City workers suffering financial hardship from the consequences of the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, and, also, to expand the program's geographic boundaries to include all affected New York City workers living and working in any of the City's five boroughs, and, furthermore, to permanently reestablish and reauthorize funding for the Mortgage and Rental Assistance program to address major disasters in the future by passing H.R. 827, also known as "the Mortgage and Rental Assistance Reauthorization Act of 2003", introduced by Representative Carolyn B. Maloney.
Items.MatterName: Reopen, Federal Emergency Management Agency's Mortgage and Rental Assistance program.

Items.Title: Resolution extending the unwavering support of the Council of the City of New York for the brave men and women of our Armed Forces serving in the current war against Iraq; and further honoring and recognizing, with deepest appreciation, the commitment, service and valor of our military personnel, and together with their families, fervently hoping for their safe return.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Support for the brave men and women of our Armed Forces serving in the current war against Iraq.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of building permits.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of building permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requirements for window guards on fire escape windows.
Items.MatterName: Requirements for window guards on fire escape windows.

Items.Title: Resolution pursuant to Section 19-511.1 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York to review forty determinations by the Taxi and Limousine Commission to approve applications for the renewal of a license to operate a base station and five determinations to approve an application for a new license to operate a base station.
Items.MatterName: Base Station License, Callup

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the Governor's proposal to close the Bronx Children's Psychiatric Center, the Bronx Psychiatric Center, and three other adult psychiatric centers that serve children and adults with serious and persistent mental disabilities in the City and State of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Condemning the Governor's proposal to close psychiatric centers that serve children and adults with serious and persistent mental disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the Governor's proposal to eliminate programs for children with mental, developmental, and physical disabilities in pre-kindergarten, early intervention, and special education.
Items.MatterName: Condemning the Governor's proposal to eliminate programs for children with mental, developmental, and physical disabilities in pre-kindergarten, early intervention, and special education.

Items.Title: Resolution demanding that the City and State carefully consider the serious adverse impact on children with mental, developmental and physical disabilities prior to the reorganization and plan implementation of New York City School District No. 75   programs, eliminating temporary teacher licensing for special education instructors, and permitting programs for special education for children with disabilities to be cut.
Items.MatterName: Reorganization and plan implementation of NYC School District #75.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact A.01562, an act to amend the general business law, in relation to providing consumers with one free copy of their credit report.
Items.MatterName: Providing consumers with one free copy of their credit report.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing the installation of food waste disposals in commercial establishments where the sale of food is a significant portion of the business activities.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the installation of food waste disposals in commercial establishments .

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill, introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1831, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty".
Items.MatterName: Certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty (S.1831)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.1844, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4214, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Loans to correction members of the NYC employees' retirement system (S.1844, A.4214)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.1881, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4261, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to retirement allowances payable to correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Retirement allowances payable to correction members of the NYC employees' retirement system (S.1881, A.4261)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.1885, and Assembly Member Straniere, A.4309, "AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the application of uniform land use review procedures".
Items.MatterName: Application of uniform land use review procedures (S.1885, A.4309)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2072, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.4581, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to probation members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Probation members of the NYC employees' retirement system (S.2072, A.4581)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2028, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4426, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto".
Items.MatterName: Permitting certain NYC correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions (S.2028, A.4426)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2029, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4427, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the return of member contributions".
Items.MatterName: Return of member contributions (S.2029, A.4427)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2071, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4594, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability retirement of certain New York city correction members".
Items.MatterName: Disability retirement of certain NYC correction members (S.2071, A.4594)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills, introduced by Senators Maltese, Padavan and Velella, S.2221, and Assembly Members Abbate, Cymbrowitz, Ortiz, Pheffer, Rivera, Seddio and Weisnberg, et al, A.4828, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of New York, in relation to the crediting of certain prior service by the police pension fund of such city".
Items.MatterName: Crediting of certain prior service by the police pension fund of such city (S.2221, A.4828)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Seminerio, A.3094, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law and the public officers law, in relation to the code of ethics of public officers".
Items.MatterName: Code of ethics of public officers (A.3094)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Dinowitz, Greene, Millman and Towns, et al, A.3142, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clearly marking certain pedestrian crosswalks in any city having a population of one million or more persons".
Items.MatterName: Clearly marking certain pedestrian crosswalks (A.3142)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Dinowitz and Abbate, et al, A.3143, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to allowing citizens to issue tickets to designated officers and appointed employees of the parking violations bureau".
Items.MatterName: Allowing citizens to issue tickets to designated officers (A.3143)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Dinowitz, Klein, Green and Kaufman, et al, A.3187, "AN ACT to dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland".
Items.MatterName: Dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland (A.3187)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2899, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.3087, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designation of deputy warden (warden level II) in the department of correction of the city of New York".
Items.MatterName: Designation of deputy warden (warden level II) in the department of correction (S.2899, A.3087)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Stringer and Pheffer, et al, A.4500, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to penalties for building code violations".
Items.MatterName: Penalties for building code violations (A.4500)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer, et al, A.4669, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the education law, in relation to reporting certain structural problems to the New York city department of buildings and penalties for noncompliance by licensed engineers".
Items.MatterName: Reporting certain structural problems to the NYC department of buildings (A.4669)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Stringer and Diaz, et al, A.4882, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of commercial bicyclists".
Items.MatterName: Regulation of commercial bicyclists (A.4882)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Stringer, O'Donnell and Grodenchik, et al, A.5244, "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to stopping at the exits of parking garages in cities with a population of one million or more".
Items.MatterName: Stopping at the exits of parking garages (A.5244)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Stringer and Diaz, et al, A.5703, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to liability insurance coverage for taxicabs and liveries, safety training for delinquent taxi drivers, and requiring taxis to display the taxi and limousine commission's complaint number on their bumpers".
Items.MatterName: Liability insurance coverage for taxicabs and liveries (A.5703)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer, A.5802, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing for a demonstration program for the fitting of taxicabs to accommodate the disabled".
Items.MatterName: Demonstration program for the fitting of taxicabs to accommodate the disabled (A.5802)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer, A.5803, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring child safety seats in taxicabs and liveries".
Items.MatterName: Requiring child safety seats in taxicabs and liveries (A.5803)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer, A.6794, "AN ACT to assign Johanna Kaplan to the proper pension plan in the New York city teachers' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Assign Johanna Kaplan to the proper pension plan (A.6794)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Marchi, Morahan, Padavan and Trunzo, S.2234, and Assembly Member Lavelle and Seddio, et al, A.1349-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all New York city police officers and firefighters".
Items.MatterName: Extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all NYC police officers and firefighters (S.2234, A.1349-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to create legislation so that a conviction for a third misdemeanor within ten years results in mandatory jail time.
Items.MatterName: Conviction for a third misdemeanor within ten years results in mandatory jail time.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to eliminate the statute of limitation for child abuse prosecution.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the statute of limitation for child abuse prosecution.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the approval and disapproval of building permits.
Items.MatterName: Approval and disapproval of building permits.
